temp.fibHeap.stixar.util
Class ListPartition<T>

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.ListPartition<T>

public class ListPartition<T>
extends java.lang.Object

A listable partition structure.

This data structure allows maintaining partitions of sets. It is fundamentally like Partition, but allows a few more convenient operations at the cost of some time and space. As in Partition, the fundamental operations are

  1. createBlock(T), the addition of elements to the set to be partitioned, which end up in their own singleton blocks.
  2. unioning of the blocks of the partitioned set.
  3. finding a representative for each block.

Also as in Partition, the implementation is based on the classical union-find data mechanism with path compression and weighted union. Any sequence of n createBlock and m>= other operations ("finds", i.e. tests for equality, or unions) takes O(m alpha(m,n)) where alpha(m,n) is the inverse Ackerman function. For most practical values of n and m, the runtime is linear.

Other conveniance methods are provided with a ListPartition. In particular, one may

  1. enumerate over the elements in a block.
  2. Split an entire block into single blocks.
  3. Enumerate all the partitions.
While these operations do not change asymptotic run-time of the union/find operations, they induce induce a sizeable constant overhead and are consequently typically several time slower than the basic partition.

find

public ListPartition.Block<T> find(ListPartition.Block<T> b)
Find a representative block for a given block.

Given two blocks b1 and b2, b1.equals(b2) iff find(b1) == find(b2)

Returns:
a representative block.
